entries.name: Way of the Renegade
entries: You have little regard for the established philosophies around marksmanship. Why should you? After all, few creatures can stay standing for long in a hail of lead. To you, quantity is quality.
{@b Deeds} {@i Initial} {@action Shoot First|EDSPFHB}; {@i Advanced} {@action RenegadeAdvancedPlaceholder|EDSPFHB}; {@i Greater} {@action RenegadeGreaterPlaceholder|EDSPFHB}

entries.name: Slam Reload
entries.requirements: You're wielding a firearm with the {@trait Capacity} trait in one hand, and your other hand is empty.
entries: You can be rough with your firearm, if it means you can send more bullets down range. You {@action Interact} to switch barrel of a firearm with the {@trait Capacity} trait you are holding, then {@action Strike} with that weapon. When {@action Strike||Striking} this way, your weapon gains a {@trait misfire|EDSPFHB} score equal to half its {@trait Capacity} score.
Alternatively, you can use Slam Reload to quickly top up your firearm, but doing so risks jamming. {@action Interact} to reload a firearm with the {@trait Capacity} trait. Make a flat check of DC 3.

entries.Success: You reload all barrels of the weapon instead of just one.

entries.name: Shoot First
entries: You can always argue you didn't later. You {@action Interact} to draw a one-handed firearm or crossbow, then {@action Strike} with that weapon against an enemy that has not yet acted in this combat. The enemy is {@condition flat-footed} to you for that attack.

entries.name: RenegadeAdvancedPlaceholder
entries.requirements: You are level 9 and your DM has finally decided to give you another ability.
entries: Crungus Bungus or something like that.

entries.name: RenegadeGreaterPlaceholder
entries: Pretend I wrote something funny here.

action.name: Unjam
action.requirements: You are holding a {@item repair kit|CRB} or you are wearing one and have a hand free.
entries: You work the mechanism of a firearm to clear the chamber. Attempt a {@skill Crafting} check. The DC is 10 + the firearm's item level + half its {@trait Capacity} score (if it has one).

entries.Critical Success: The firearm is no longer Misfired, and is fully reloaded.
entries.Success: The firearm is no longer Misfired, and is empty.
entries.Critical Failure: The firearm is no longer Misfired, but gains the {@condition broken|CRB} condition, and is empty.

trait.name: Misfire
entries: Misfires happen when your firearm fails to keep up with how fast you're handling it. When Striking with the weapon and the result on the d20 is equal to or less than the misfire score, the attack becomes a critical failure and your gun misfires. A misfired firearm is inoperable until {@action Unjam|EDSPFHB|unjammed}, {@action Repair|CRB|repaired}, or cleaned with a {@item firearm cleaning kit|G&G}.
